title.narrative: Actions to Strengthen Performance for Inclusive and Responsive Education Program

description.narrative: The objective of the Actions to Strengthen Performance for Inclusive and Responsive Education Program for Results for Pakistan is to support the government to: (i) respond to school disruptions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic; (ii) recover access and improve education quality; and, (iii) enhance sector resilience through better coordination, with a focus on disadvantaged areas and vulnerable populations. The Results Areas of the Program are as follows: Results Area 1. Response, Recovery and Resilience: Enhanced targeting of COVID-19 education response. This Results Area will enhance targeting of the COVID-19 education response, with a focus on disadvantaged districts. Results Area 2. Improved learning opportunities for Out-Of-School Children (OOSC) and at-risk students. This Results Area will expand equitable access to education by engaging OOSC through both traditional and flexible multimodal education approaches to provide them a pathway towards education certification. Results Area 3. Stronger federal-provincial coordination and management, which means: (a) strengthen data systems; (b) support knowledge sharing; (c) support the digitization of government processes; (d) support better use of data; (e) support interventions to incentivize behavioral change by teachers, students, and parents. The three Results Areas include targeted actions to reduce gender gaps and mitigate the gender-based risks associated with school disruptions.

activity-date.narrative: Actual start date of the activity
Planned end date of the activity
Actual end date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

title.narrative: Recover gross enrollment rates in lagging areas/districts (p.p.)

target.value: Average rates for lagging areas/districts from PSLM 2018-2019 at district level (available Oct 2020)

title.narrative: Increase of health and safety protocol awareness

target.value: At least 70% of public-school teachers are aware of safety protocols

title.narrative: Improvement of federal-provincial coordination and sector management

target.value: Recommendations from technical working groups presented and adopted by IPEMC

title.narrative: Reduction in learning poverty in lagging areas/districts (p.p.)
Number of students enrolled in multimodal programs in lagging areas/districts

target.value: DLR 2. Up to 20,000 students enrolled in multimodal programs in lagging areas/districts
On-going review of distance learning content matching with national objectives

title.narrative: Approval and availability of funds for the grant mechanism under NEEP

target.value: DLR 10.5. The NEEP Budget of at least $30,000,000 equivalent is approved, allocated and released to provinces for FY25

title.narrative: Number of classrooms for grade 6-8, built and/or rehabilitated in lagging areas/districts

target.value: DLR 7. Up to 2,500 classrooms built/rehabilitated

title.narrative: Number of students receiving learning materials in lagging areas/districts

target.value: Up to 250,000 distance learning kits received by students

title.narrative: Allocation of grant funding from provinces to lagging areas/districts

baseline.value: No grant mechanism at province level

target.value: Provinces allocate a percentage of development budget to performance grants for lagging areas/districts

title.narrative: Improved WASH facilities in schools attended by girls

target.value: DLR 8.Up to 1,000 schools attended by girls with rehabilitated WASH facilities

title.narrative: Expanding connectivity for education in at least lagging areas/districts

target.value: 7,000 free public WIFI access points and subsidized access to educational connectivity programs, in lagging districts

title.narrative: Improvement of the collection of education data, analysis, and transparency

target.value: DLR 11.2. Standardized data is collected, analyzed and publicly released for all provinces in the country

title.narrative: Pilot on OOSC enrolled in elementary-level distance education programs with a pathway to certification (disaggregated by gender andeducation)

target.value: Prepare report, policy guidance, and workshops to discuss scale up options for scale-up and certification of distance education

title.narrative: Health and safety protocol awareness in education

target.value: Safety Protocols awareness campaigns for teacher and district officials
Develop pedagogical guidance notes from assessment results

title.narrative: Implementation of teacher training programs on distance learning, accelerated programs and formative assessment

target.value: 80,000 teachers trained on distance learning (or accelerated learning) and formative assessment

title.narrative: Improvement of hygiene in public schools

target.value: At least 100,000 public schools received cleaning kits

title.narrative: Knowledge sharing events and capacity building, series on what works in education

target.value: Dissemination, digitization, and repository of innovative approaches to teaching

title.narrative: Implementation of distance teacher coaching program with a focus on lagging areas/districts

target.value: Training of 16,000 coaches on delivery of virtual support for distance and accelerated learning

title.narrative: Number of children, teachers, and parents reached with sensitization campaigns for education and mental health wellbeing – (of which are girls)
Number of students benefiting from new accelerated learning programs in lagging areas/districts
Number of girls enrolled in multimodal programs in lagging areas/districts
Take-up, impact, and process assessments of distance education and communication campaigns for adaptive implementation

target.value: Monitoring and randomized mobile check-in with coaches and teachers to assess implementation fidelity

title.narrative: Number of children reached with back-to-school sensitization campaigns and behavioral nudges, focusing on girls and marginalized groups
Number of received teaching materials, including scripted lessons, and teachers guides with a focus on lagging areas/districts

target.value: 20,000 tablets, solar chargers with internet connectivity; and supplementary materials received by teachers (e.g. scripted lessonplans, guides, etc.), in lagging districts
